French PM Bayrou will seek vote of confidence on September 8
subhead: French Prime Minister François Bayrou will request the vote in a special session ahead of the autumn budget process. The left-wing La France Insoumise and far-right Rassemblement National parties said they would vote against his minority government.

title: Italy's Salvini renews attacks on Macron
subhead: Two days after the French Foreign Ministry summoned Italy's ambassador, the Italian deputy prime minister doubled down on his criticism of the French president, portraying him as a warmonger over the Ukrainian issue.

title: French Riviera town unveils monument equating Nazism and Communism, fueling protests
subhead: Saint-Raphaël's right-wing mayor, no stranger to media stunts, has vowed to 'put an end to the lies about the reality of communist totalitarianism.' In response, the French Communist Party and other left-wing groups denounced the 'revisionism of history.'

title: UK's far right mobilizes around asylum crisis: 'I don't want to pay for them anymore'
subhead: Following a court decision upholding the closure of a hotel housing migrants in Epping Forest, opposition to their presence has shown no sign of waning, as seen on Saturday, August 23, in Horley, southern England.

Is 'abundance' the new watchword of US Democrats?
subhead: Born in California, the concept of 'abundance' has captivated the centrist wing of the Democratic Party. It advocates for an interventionist state paired with deregulation to facilitate investment and increase the supply of essential goods such as housing, energy, transportation and healthcare.
byline: By Corine Lesnes (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: François Truffaut's obsession with Isabelle Adjani
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (2/6). While making a name for herself at the Comédie Française, the young actress became the French filmmaker's obsession, who courted her insistently on the set of 'The Story of Adèle H.' in 1975. She resisted him and made her mark with a performance full of restrained violence.

title: In Iowa, soul-searching Democrats want revenge
subhead: In a rural state that swung Republican in 2016, Democrats are trying to unite those angered by cuts to welfare programs.
